title: Trump bashes Jeremy Corbyn, praises ‘great’ Boris Johnson
text:
U.S. President Donald Trump | Ludovic Marin/AFP via Getty Images Trump bashes Jeremy Corbyn, praises ‘great’ Boris Johnson US president says Labour leader will have a hard time calling a no-confidence vote in UK PM.

Donald Trump on Tuesday gave his expert opinion on Italian politics, and a day later turned to the U.K.

On the day that Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced he wants to suspend the start of parliament, a move critics say is intended to stop opposition to a no-deal Brexit, the U.S. president tweeted in support of his British friend.

He said it would be "very hard" for Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn "to seek a no-confidence vote" in Johnson "especially in the light that Boris is exactly what the U.K. has been looking for, & will prove to be 'a great one!' Love U.K." (punctuation very much the president's own).

Corbyn has called on opposition party leaders and MPs to support a Labour-led vote of no confidence in Johnson's government, in a bid to force him from office and stop a no-deal Brexit.

On Tuesday, Trump backed another of his European friends, Giuseppe Conte, saying: "Starting to look good for the highly respected Prime Minister of the Italian Republic, Giuseppe Conte. Represented Italy powerfully at the G-7. Loves his Country greatly & works well with the USA. A very talented man who will hopefully remain Prime Minister!"

In an earlier version of that tweet, Trump called him "Giuseppi" Conte.

Would be very hard for Jeremy Corbyn, the leader of Britain’s Labour Party, to seek a no-confidence vote against New Prime Minister Boris Johnson, especially in light of the fact that Boris is exactly what the U.K. has been looking for, & will prove to be “a great one!” Love U.K. — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) August 28, 2019
description: US president says Labour leader will have a hard time calling a no-confidence vote in UK PM.
